name: calculate
description: Perform mathematical calculations including basic arithmetic, trigonometry, and advanced functions

function.name: calculate
function.description: A powerful mathematical calculator that evaluates complex mathematical expressions including basic arithmetic operations (+, -, *, /), trigonometric functions (sin, cos, tan, asin, acos, atan), hyperbolic functions (sinh, cosh, tanh), logarithmic functions (log, log10, log2), exponential functions (exp, pow), square roots (sqrt, cbrt), absolute values (abs), rounding functions (ceil, floor, round), and min/max operations. Supports mathematical constants like pi and e. Returns precise numerical results with configurable decimal precision. Includes security validation to prevent code injection attacks.

expression.description: Mathematical expression to evaluate using standard mathematical notation. Supports: arithmetic operators (+, -, *, /, %), parentheses for grouping, mathematical functions (sin, cos, tan, log, sqrt, etc.), constants (pi, e), and nested operations. Examples: '2 + 3 * 4' (basic arithmetic), 'sin(pi/2)' (trigonometry), 'sqrt(16) + log(10)' (mixed functions), 'pow(2, 8)' (exponentiation), '(5 + 3) * (10 - 2)' (complex grouping)

precision.description: Number of decimal places to include in the result for precise mathematical calculations. Affects the rounding of the final answer. Range: 0-15 decimal places. Lower values (0-2) for whole numbers or currency, medium values (3-6) for general calculations, higher values (7-15) for scientific or engineering calculations

response_format.description: Returns a JSON object with 'success' (boolean), 'timestamp' (ISO string), 'tool_name' (string), 'expression' (original input), 'result' (calculated numerical value), and 'precision' (decimal places used). Error responses include 'error' field with detailed error message for debugging invalid expressions.
